document_title: Acute liver failure: Causes, signs, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: suy-gan-cap.json_4_Are complications of acute liver failure dangerous?
subsection_content:
Acute liver failure, if not detected and treated promptly, will lead to many very dangerous complications. Some typical examples include: (3)
Kidney failure: Kidney failure due to liver failure is also called hepatorenal syndrome; Kidney failure: Kidney failure due to liver failure is also called hepatorenal syndrome.
Sepsis (including aspiration pneumonia and fever): This condition requires treatment with broad-spectrum antibiotics.; Sepsis (including aspiration pneumonia and fever): This condition requires treatment with broad-spectrum antibiotics.
Cerebral edema: This is one of the most common causes of death from acute liver failure. When there is cerebral edema, ischemia and herniation will occur, leading to increased intracranial pressure and traumatic brain injury. In particular, bodies with arterial ammonia concentrations higher than 200 micromoles/liter will face the risk of intracranial hypertension. Factors that stimulate cerebral edema include: hypoxia, systemic hypotension, decreased cerebral perfusion pressure (CPP), and astrocytic swelling.; Cerebral edema: This is one of the most common causes of death from acute liver failure. When there is cerebral edema, ischemia and herniation will occur, leading to increased intracranial pressure and traumatic brain injury. In particular, bodies with arterial ammonia concentrations higher than 200 micromoles/liter will face the risk of intracranial hypertension. Factors that stimulate cerebral edema include: hypoxia, systemic hypotension, decreased cerebral perfusion pressure (CPP), and astrocytic swelling.
Hepatic encephalopathy: Encephalopathy is also a common complication of acute liver failure, ranging from mild insomnia and restlessness to severe pre-coma and hepatic coma.; Hepatic encephalopathy: Encephalopathy is also a common complication of acute liver failure, ranging from mild insomnia and restlessness to severe pre-coma and hepatic coma.
Blood clotting disorders and multiple organ failure: This condition can be fatal.; Blood clotting disorders and multiple organ failure: This condition can be fatal.
